com.absynth.battleship.players

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Computer, PlayerAdapter, User

    public interface Player
    Interface for a player of the battleship game.
    Author:
    David Boivin (Absynth)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPoint()
      Provides a way to add a point to this player's score.
      Coord fire()
      Method which is used to ask the player to return a coordinate which the board will consider a "fire" event.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Gets then player identifier, usually the name of the player.
      int getPoints()
      A way to keep track of the scores between players.
      void invalidPlacement(java.lang.String errorMesage)
      Method used to indicate that a placement choice made by this player is not valid for a reason indicate by the string parameter.
      boolean isSkipped()
      Method which dictates if a player's turn should be skipped
      Coord placeGrenade()
      Method which is used to ask the player to return a coordinate which the board will use as to place a grenade.
      Coord placeShip()
      Method which is used to ask the player to return a coordinate which the board will se to place a ship.
      void setSkipped(boolean skipped)
      Method which sets skip turn flag to given parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Gets then player identifier, usually the name of the player.
        Returns:
        Returns a string identifier.

      • getPoints

        int getPoints()
        A way to keep track of the scores between players.
        Returns:
        The amount of points this player has accumulated.

      • addPoint

        void addPoint()
        Provides a way to add a point to this player's score.

      • isSkipped

        boolean isSkipped()
        Method which dictates if a player's turn should be skipped
        Returns:
        true if the player should skip its next turn.

      • setSkipped

        void setSkipped(boolean skipped)
        Method which sets skip turn flag to given parameter.
        Parameters:
        skipped - whether then next turn should be skipped.

      • fire

        Coord fire()
        Method which is used to ask the player to return a coordinate which the board will consider a "fire" event.
        Returns:
        A coordinate on the board.

      • placeGrenade

        Coord placeGrenade()
        Method which is used to ask the player to return a coordinate which the board will use as to place a grenade.
        Returns:
        A coordinate on the board.

      • placeShip

        Coord placeShip()
        Method which is used to ask the player to return a coordinate which the board will se to place a ship.
        Returns:
        A coordinate on the board.

      • invalidPlacement

        void invalidPlacement(java.lang.String errorMesage)
        Method used to indicate that a placement choice made by this player is not valid for a reason indicate by the string parameter.
        Parameters:
        errorMesage - A brief description of the problem with the chosen placement
